tool.name: xMSannotator (simple)
tool.command: Rscript -e 'annotation <- xmsannotator::simple_annotation( peaks = rhdf5::h5read("$peaks", "peaks"), adducts = rhdf5::h5read("$adducts", "adducts"), metabolites = rhdf5::h5read("$metabolites", "metabolites"), mz_tolerance_ppm = as.double($mz_tolerance_ppm) )' -e 'rhdf5::h5write(annotation, "$annotation", "annotation")'
tool.help:
Annotate the peak intensity table (such as outputted from apLCMS) with metabolites from the metabolite database.
The annotation process generates all possible metabolite-adduct pairs from the metabolite and adduct databases and matches those pairs to the measured peaks. A metabolite-adduct pair is pronounced as a match to the peak when the difference of their masses are withing some tolerance.
